answers.answer: Hello,we cannot know what type of diabetes your father has, though I would hazard a guess that it is type 2 (age related).  His doctor can confirm this.Definitely he will need medications to control his blood sugar (either oral or insulin).He will also need to control what he eats, particularly restricting carbs, which he is no longer able to process properly.  He will also need to regularly monitor his blood sugar to make sure his levels are on target - and if they aren't he will need to adjust his medication / food / exercise levels.He and you should learn all about diabetes and it's management.  It is possible to manage diabetes well and to end up with blood sugars that are normal, or very close to it.

question: My father is being undergoing blood tests.. And has been told that his glucose level is 287.I want to know what kind of precautions should he take and with all that will he be able to come back to the normal range ever.?
title: Glucose 287- is that diabetes type 1 or 2
